REALTOR® Broker of the Year is one of the highest honors that this Board can bestow upon one of its members. This award is presented annually to a REALTOR® nominated by their peers and selected by past recipients of the award. The member’s involvement in civic affairs and participation in local, state and national committees are taken into consideration, as well as their REALTOR® spirit and business accomplishments.
children.html: REALTOR® Broker of the Year is one of the highest honors that this Board can bestow upon one of its members. This award is presented annually to a REALTOR® nominated by their peers and selected by past recipients of the award. The member’s involvement in civic affairs and participation in local, state and national committees are taken into consideration, as well as their REALTOR® spirit and business accomplishments.

children.content: REALTOR® Broker of the Year is one of the highest honors that this Board can bestow upon one of its members. This award is presented annually to a REALTOR® nominated by their peers and selected by past recipients of the award. The member’s involvement in civic affairs and participation in local, state and national committees are taken into consideration, as well as their REALTOR® spirit and business accomplishments.

children.content: The Salesperson of the Year Award is based on an evaluation of the nominee’s outstanding contribution to the real estate industry in terms of overall achievement. This award is independent of the top producer awards given out by individual companies. The award recipient will be chosen based on involvement with GSBOR, Missouri REALTORS® (MR), and the National Association of REALTORS® (NAR), along with the nominee’s spirit of cooperation, personal production, and educational achievements.
children.html: The Salesperson of the Year Award is based on an evaluation of the nominee’s outstanding contribution to the real estate industry in terms of overall achievement. children.content: This award gives recognition to the REALTOR® who has proven their commitment by selling, leasing, and/or listing a minimum of ten sides of property in the previous calendar year, the first full year calendar year after the Rookie is licensed.
children.html: This award gives recognition to the REALTOR® who has proven their commitment by selling, leasing, and/or listing a minimum of ten sides of property in the previous calendar year, the first full year calendar year after the Rookie is licensed.

children.content: This award gives recognition to the REALTOR® who has proven their commitment by selling, leasing, and/or listing a minimum of ten sides of property in the previous calendar year, the first full year calendar year after the Rookie is licensed.
The following is considered in the application process as well: participation in local board activities, professionalism/ethics, community service, education, and achievement.

children.content: Margaret Martin epitomized professionalism and cooperative spirit in her practice of real estate. She was a great believer in education and the responsibility of citizens to be involved in the community. She was always willing to help her fellow REALTORS® succeed in their profession.

Kirk Hewitt’s longstanding commitment to REALTORS® Helping People led to the 2018 establishment of the “Kirk Hewitt Community Champion” Award. Future recipients will demonstrate Kirk’s passion for involvement in helping those in need in our communities.

This award recognizes the GSBOR affiliate member who has been active in promoting good relations among REALTORS®, affiliate members, and the public. Affiliates are graded on volunteerism, ethics in business, promotion of REALTOR® endorsed programs and policies, and community involvement.

Web Accessibility
children.html: Web Accessibility

children.content: Web Accessibility

Greater Springfield Board of Realtors®, Inc. is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. We are continually improving the user experience for everyone and applying relevant accessibility standards.

If you have difficulty accessing content, have difficulty viewing a file on the website, or notice any accessibility problems, please contact us to specify the nature of the accessibility issue and any assistive technology you use. We will strive to provide the content you need in the format you require.
